item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is Sophie Shi, a fourth year Pre-Dental Biology undergraduate student at The University of Texas at Austin. To feed my growing interest in biology, I currently work in the Matouschek Lab where we explore the Ubiquitin-Proteasome system. I also love being a volunteer at UT Informal Classes Aimed at Adults with Intelectual and Developmental Disabilities. When I am not studying or in the lab, you can probably find me getting a great workout in, walking around at the farmer’s market, or making a watercolor painting!

item.title: Blog
item.description: This semester, we covered a wide variety of statistical training techniques, working to manipulate, visualize, and interpret patterns seen commonly in biological data. For the most part, we primarily used statistical computing language R through Rstudio. In the last part of the course, we shifted toward analyzing text and string-type data using regular expressions, leading to sequence alignment and other related material. Here, we shifted to Python. In this code below, we mess around with the re.

item.title: A Glimpse at Life Expectancies and Estimated Cancer Deaths
item.description: cancer <- read.csv("~/Downloads/cancerdeath.csv") life <- read.csv("~/Downloads/life.csv") head(cancer) ## State Estimated.New.Cases..2019 Estimated.Deaths..2019. ## 1 ## 2 ## 3 Alabama 28,950 10,630 ## 4 Alaska 3,090 1,120 ## 5 Arizona 37,490 12,470 ## 6 Arkansas 16,580 6,800 head(life) ## State Overall.Avg.. Black.Avg. Latino.Avg. Asian.Avg. ## 1 Hawaii 81.3 79.7 87.3 83.5 ## 2 Minnesota 81.1 82.5 76.8 82 ## 3 Connecticut 80.8 77.8 83.1 89.1 ## 4 California 80.8 75.1 83.2 86.

item.title: Survey of Labour and Income Dynamics for Ontario (1994)
item.description: Introduction This SLID dataset is from carData. It contains survey data from a 1994 Canadian Survey of Labour and Income Dynamics for the province of Ontario, Canada. 7425 cases and 5 variables– hourly wage from all jobs, number of years of education, age in years, sex (male, female), and language (French, English, Other). The missing data points have been removed. data<-carData::SLID data<-data%>%remove_missing() ## Warning: Removed 3438 rows containing missing values.
